ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Taste that! You are the mighty one, the noble one!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Taste it," (they will be told). "You were indeed the mighty and noble!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Taste this, you are a person mighty and noble!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will be told, "Suffer the torment. You had thought yourselves to be majestic and honorable.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Saying “Taste it! Indeed you only are the most honourable, the dignified!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Taste you (this)! Verily, you were (pretending to be) the mighty, the generous."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Taste; you forsooth are the mighty, the honorable:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Taste! Surely thou art the mighty, the noble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (Saying): Taste! Lo! thou wast forsooth the mighty, the noble!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Taste this; you who considered yourself the mighty, the honourable!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Taste thou! thou art indeed mighty, honoured!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [and tell them,] “Taste this! Indeed you are the [self-styled] mighty and noble!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Taste thou (this)! Truly wast thou mighty, full of honour!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Taste you (this)! Verily, you were (pretending to be) the mighty, the generous!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (Saying): 'Taste, surely you are the mighty and noble!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Taste! You who were powerful and noble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [It will be said], "Taste! Indeed, you are the honored, the noble!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:49] And it will be said to him: ‘Taste!, that is, [taste] the chastisement. Indeed you are the mighty, the noble one!, as you claimed when you used to say, ‘There is nothing between its two mountains [sc. Mecca] that is mightier or nobler than me!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((Saying): Taste) Abu Jahl! (Lo! thou wast forsooth the mighty) among your own folk, (the noble) in their midst! And it is also said that this means: you were the mighty who felt powerful through your own folk, the noble who was magnanimous with them!
